exceptions.tactic: apply star_ind with (P := fun x0 y0 => star T' x0 y0).
exceptions.exn: In environment I, X, Y, Z : Type R', R1' : relation2 X Y S' : relation2 Y Z R, R1 : relation2 X Y S : relation2 Y Z T', T : relation X F', F : I -> relation2 X Y H : incl T T' x, y : X XY : plus T x y Unable to unify "star T' ?M1387 ?M1388" with "ex2 (fun y : X => T' x y) (fun y0 : X => star T' y0 y)".

exceptions.tactic: intros y0 x0 z0 H0 IH; apply S_star with (w := w); auto.
intros y0 x0' z0 H0 IH; apply S_star with (w := w); auto.
intros y0 x0' z0 H0' IH; apply S_star with (w := w); auto.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
Z: Type
Y: Type
X: Type
I: Type
R1': relation2 X Y
R': relation2 X Y
S': relation2 Y Z
R1: relation2 X Y
R: relation2 X Y
S: relation2 Y Z
T: relation X
T': relation X
F: I -> relation2 X Y
F': I -> relation2 X Y

Goal:
incl T T' -> incl (plus T) (plus T')

Premises:
incl : forall X Y : Type, relation (relation2 X Y)
relation2 = fun X Y : Type => X -> Y -> Prop : Type -> Type -> Type Arguments relation2 (_ _)%type_scope
relation = fun X : Type => relation2 X X : Type -> Type Arguments relation _%type_scope
plus : forall X : Type, relation X -> relation X
ssrbool.onPhantom : forall (P : ?T -> Prop) (x : ?T), ssreflect.phantom Prop (P x) where ?T : [I : Type X : Type Y : Type Z : Type R' : relation2 X Y R1' : relation2 X Y S' : relation2 Y Z R : relation2 X Y R1 : relation2 X Y S : relation2 Y Z T' : relation X T : relation X F' : I -> relation2 X Y F : I -> relation2 X Y |- Type]
comp : forall X Y Z : Type, relation2 X Y -> relation2 Y Z -> relation2 X Z
union2 : forall X Y : Type, relation2 X Y -> relation2 X Y -> relation2 X Y
union : forall X Y I : Type, (I -> X -> Y -> Prop) -> relation2 X Y
eta2 : forall X Y : Type, relation2 X Y -> relation2 X Y
trans : forall X Y : Type, relation2 X Y -> relation2 Y X
star_incl = fun (H : incl T T') (x y : X) (XY : star T x y) => star_ind (fun x0 y0 : X => star T' x0 y0) (fun x0 : X => star_refl T' x0) (fun (w x0 y0 : X) (XW : T x0 w) (_ : star T w y0) (IH : star T' w y0) => S_star x0 (H x0 w XW) IH) XY : incl T T' -> incl (star T) (star T') Expanded type for implicit arguments star_incl : incl T T' -> forall x y : X, star T x y -> star T' x y Arguments star_incl _ [x y]
union_st : forall X Y : Type, set (relation2 X Y) -> X -> Y -> Prop
eeq : forall X Y : Type, relation (relation2 X Y)
reflexive : forall X : Type, relation X -> Prop
antisymmetric : forall X : Type, relation X -> Prop
symmetric : forall X : Type, relation X -> Prop
transitive : forall X : Type, relation X -> Prop
comp_incl = fun (H : forall (x : X) (y : Y), R x y -> R' x y) (H0 : forall (x : Y) (y : Z), S x y -> S' x y) (x : X) (y : Z) (H1 : exists2 y0 : Y, R x y0 & S y0 y) => match H1 with | ex_intro2 _ _ t H2 H3 => ex_intro2 (fun y0 : Y => R' x y0) (fun y0 : Y => S' y0 y) t (H x t H2) (H0 t y H3) end : incl R R' -> incl S S' -> incl (comp R S) (comp R' S') Expanded type for implicit arguments comp_incl : incl R R' -> incl S S' ->...-> exists2 y0 : Y, R' x y0 & S' y0 y Arguments comp_incl _ _ [x y]
union_incl : (forall i : I, incl (F i) (F' i)) -> incl (union F) (union F')
trans_incl = fun (H : incl R R') (x : Y) (y : X) (H0 : trans R x y) => H y x H0 : incl R R' -> incl (trans R) (trans R') Expanded type for implicit arguments trans_incl : incl R R' -> forall (x : Y) (y : X), trans R x y -> R' y x Arguments trans_incl _ [x y]
union2_incl = fun (H : forall (x : X) (y : Y), R x y -> R' x y) (H0 : forall (x : X) (y : Y), R1 x y -> R1' x y) (x : X) (y : Y) (H1 : R x y \/ R1 x y) => or_ind (fun H2 : R x y => or_introl (H x y H2)) (fun H2 : R1 x y => or_intror (H0 x y H2)) H1 : incl R R' -> incl R1 R1' -> incl (union2 R R1) (union2 R' R1') Expanded type for implicit arguments union2_incl : incl R R' -> incl R1 R1' -> forall (x : X) (y : Y), union2 R R1 x y -> R' x y \/ R1' x y Arguments union2_incl _ _ [x y]
star_sind : forall (X : Type) (R : relation X) (P : X -> X -> SProp), (forall x : X, P x x) -> (forall y x z : X, R x y -> star R y z -> P y z -> P x z) -> forall x x0 : X, star R x x0 -> P x x0
star_ind : forall (X : Type) (R : relation X) (P : X -> X -> Prop), (forall x : X, P x x) -> (forall y x z : X, R x y -> star R y z -> P y z -> P x z) -> forall x x0 : X, star R x x0 -> P x x0
trans_eeq = fun H : incl R R' /\ incl R' R => and_ind (fun (H0 : incl R R') (H1 : incl R' R) => conj (fun (x : Y) (y : X) (H2 : trans R x y) => H0 y x H2) (fun (x : Y) (y : X) (H2 : trans R' x y) => H1 y x H2)) H : eeq R R' -> eeq (trans R) (trans R')
set = fun X : Type => X -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments set _%type_scope
Inductive star (X : Type) (R : relation X) : relation X := star_refl : forall x : X, star R x x | S_star : forall y x z : X, R x y -> star R y z -> star R x z Arguments star [X]%type_scope Arguments star_refl [X]%type_scope Arguments S_star [X]%type_scope [R y] _ [z]
ssrfun.right_injective : forall S T R : Type, (S -> T -> R) -> Prop
Variant phantom (T : Type) (p : T) : Prop := Phantom : ssreflect.phantom T p Arguments ssreflect.phantom _%type_scope Arguments ssreflect.Phantom _%type_scope
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : BinNums.Z | Zpos : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.Z | Zneg : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinNums.Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments BinNums.Zneg _%positive_scope

```coq
intros H x y XY.
apply star_ind with (P := fun x0 y0 => star T' x0 y0).
- intros x0; apply star_refl.
- intros y0 x0 z0 H0 IH; apply S_star with (w := w); auto.
Qed.
```

original: intros H x y XY. apply star_ind with (P := fun x0 y0 => star T' x0 y0). - intros x0; apply star_refl. - intros y0 x0 z0 H0 IH; apply S_star with (w := w); auto.
